Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module C
Section 3: Emergency Preparedness, Response & Recovery

Additional Essential Elements of Plan

These additional essential elements of Emergency Plans are also required under Center (R400.8161) and Family and Group Home (R400.1945) Rules.

  • Plan for Contacting Parents and Reuniting Families

    There must be a plan for contacting parents and reuniting families. Proper identification and reliable communication are important here.

  • Plan for How Infants and Toddlers Will Be Accommodated

    There must be a plan for how infants and toddlers will be accommodated during each type of emergency. Here you need to consider the unique developmental level, and nutritional and transportation needs of this age group.

  • Plan for How Each Child With Special Needs Will Be Accommodated

    The Emergency Plan must also include a plan for how each child with special needs will be accommodated during each type of emergency. This plan must be individualized to ensure the child will be properly protected.

  • Plan for How Children With Chronic Medical Needs Will Be Accommodated

    The plan must also include a plan so children with chronic medical needs will be accommodated during each type of emergency. This requires a lot of planning. Each child with chronic medical needs should have an individualized plan of care. A copy of this should be with emergency supplies. If evacuation or/and relocation is required, you must bring all the necessary medications and equipment needed for this child. A child with physical limitations may also need special consideration for planning transportation if relocated. You may also need to plan for a backup power source for any medical equipment. Each child’s unique care plan should be discussed with the child’s parents and child care provider.

The Save the Children Disaster Checklist found in the Support material section of this session is a good resource to help check that you have remembered all elements needed in the Emergency Plan.
